abiquo.storage.check.delay.propertyDescription: # Delay between checks of the storage infrastructure (milliseconds)

abiquo.virtualfactory.networking.bridgeP.propertyDescription: # Prefix to name used to identify the VLAN bridge in the KVM, XEN, VBOX # hypevisor nodes

abiquo.kairosdb.host.propertyDescription: # Address where KairosDb is located for VM monitoring

abiquo.virtualfactory.oraclevm.hardParti.propertyDescription: # Enable Oracle VM Hard Partitioning support (CPU pinning). The default value # is ‘false’.

abiquo.nodecollector.infcheck.propertyDescription: # Time between executions of infrastructure check (minutes)

abiquo.amazon.loadbalancer.healthcheck.h.propertyDescription: # Specifies the number of consecutive health probe successes required before # moving the instance to the Healthy state. #

abiquo.api.session.cookie.name.propertyDescription: # Abiquo session cookie name. This session does not store anything.

abiquo.openstack.credentialType.propertyDescription: # Configures the authentication type. In OpenStack installations, the standard # method of authentication is using a password. However, if the RAX_KSKEY extension # (see http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-identity-service/2.0/content/Admin_API_Service_Developer_Operations-RAX-KSKEY-admin.html) # is installed, users might be able to use an API key to authenticate. #

abiquo.vsm.actor.creation.delay.azure.propertyDescription: # The delay in milliseconds added between the creation of actors on # VSM start up for each public cloud plugin (PC)

client.SERVER_ADDRESS.propertyDescription: # Used by the Flex UI to test connectivity to the backend API stub

RemoteDisplay.vnc.keyMap.propertyDescription: # ESX and ESXi only: When using a virtual machine as a VNC server, specify # the language to use for the keyboard when VNC clients connect. If this # property does not exist, the hypervisor will use the first value in the # client-config.xml.jsp in webapps/client-premium/config and the default in # this case is the US101 keyboard map (US English). This property is now the # default setting to complement the Virtual Machine configuration popup. See # Configuring Remote Access to Virtual Machines

abiquo.vsm.pollingfrequency.xenserver.propertyDescription: # The delay between VSM polling of virtual machines in milliseconds for each # hypervisor plugin (HV)

abiquo.stale.sessions.check.delay.propertyDescription: # Delay between executions of stale sessions check (milliseconds)

abiquo.virtualfactory.xenserver.reposito.propertyDescription: # The Storage Area network datastore location where the virtual disks are # stored (usually the same as abiquo.appliancemanager.repositoryLocation)

abiquo.ldap.authentication.server.protoc.propertyDescription: # Protocol to be used when authenticating to a LDAP/Active Directory.

abiquo.httpProxy.user.propertyDescription: # User of HTTP proxy for Appliance Manager/API to Internet communication # (download template definition list, template definition, VM disk file)

abiquo.virtualfactory.hyperv.repositoryL.propertyDescription: # The CIFS address //IP/resource/ where Windows can locate the virtual disk # repository

abiquo.virtualfactory.oraclevm.createSpa.propertyDescription: # Create additional hard disks on the datastore as sparse. The default value # is ‘true’.

abiquo.rabbitmq.connectionTimeout.propertyDescription: # Timeout for establishing a connection to RabbitMQ. The default value of 0 # means to wait indefinitely until connection established or error # (milliseconds)

abiquo.docker.registry.propertyDescription: # The URL of the Docker Registry that Abiquo will use to pull images. # For example: http://localhost:5000

abiquo.ldap.read.timeout.propertyDescription: # Timeout to complete the connections to the LDAP/Active Directory server # (milliseconds) Default value is 10000

abiquo.captcha.private.key.propertyDescription: # reCAPTCHA private key for user password reset. Obtain keys from Google

abiquo.openstack.autoGenerateKeyPairs.propertyDescription: # Enable automatic generation of key pairs. This enables the automatic # generation of key pairs, to make sure that the owner of the virtual machine # will have SSH access to the virtual machines that are deployed. #

abiquo.ldap.connection.timeout.propertyDescription: # Timeout to establish the connections to the LDAP/Active Directory server # (milliseconds) Default value is 5000

abiquo.vncport.min.propertyDescription: # First port of the VNC range to be used when allocating virtual machines

abiquo.virtualfactory.azure.defaultLogin.propertyDescription: # Default login for virtual machines if not found in the template

abiquo.mail.path.propertyDescription: # Path to email template and text .properties files for user password reset

abiquo.storagemanager.nexenta.blocksize.propertyDescription: # Specifies the block size in KB for the volumes created in Nexenta storage # devices. Abiquo does not validate this property. Abiquo supports values # from 8 to 128 KB inclusive but Nexenta requires the value to be a power of 2 #

abiquo.security.encrypt.propertyDescription: # This property must have the same value on all API and remote services servers. # If true, Abiquo will read the custom seed file at /etc/abiquo/.store # If you create the seed file, but the property is not true, Abiquo will use # the default seed. Abiquo requires access to the configured seed file to work # with passwords. If it is lost, you will need to regenerate ALL passwords # stored in Abiquo.

abiquo.instance.targetDiskFormatType.xen.propertyDescription: # Disk format type for instances taken in virtual datacenters for each # hypervisor plugin (HV) # Set to empty to avoid any additional conversion (use the instance operation result format)

workflow.connect.timeout.propertyDescription: # Maximum waiting time in milliseconds to establish a connection with workflow # endpoint

abiquo.appliancemanager.downloads.propertyDescription: # Maximum number of concurrent template downloads. The default value of -1 # means unlimited

abiquo.repository.timeoutSeconds.propertyDescription: # Time to wait for checking if the .abiquo_repository file mark is present in # the NFS repository filesystem (helps in finding a slow NFS repository) # (seconds)

abiquo.virtualfactory.azure.wait.timeout.propertyDescription: # Timeout waiting for an operation to complete, e.g deploy / undeploy

abiquo.vsm.vmsyncfrequency.xenserver.propertyDescription: # The delay between virtual machine synchronizer operations in milliseconds # for each hypervisor plugin (HV)

abiquo.m.identity.propertyDescription: # Identity that M should use to perform requests to the Abiquo Server (API)

abiquo.dvs.enabled.propertyDescription: # Enable DVS. Note that the vCenter login and password can be used when DVS # is disabled

abiquo.appliancemanager.upload.progressI.propertyDescription: # Refresh virtual machine template upload progress (milliseconds)

abiquo.dvs.vcenter.password.propertyDescription: # Password of the vCenter user account. The underscore character "_" is not # allowed in this field. Create a user with the same password in the vCenter # in order to use the DVS or vCenter with Abiquo. In vSphere 5.1, you must # create this account in an Active Directory domain or using a VMware Single # Sign-on system, NOT as a local Windows account on the vCenter. If # 'abiquo.dvs.enabled' is set to true, this property is required. The DVS # vCenter user and password properties are also used for connecting to # vCenter even if DVS is not used, for example, when deleting orphans. So the # user and password properties can be used even when abiquo.dvs.enabled is # set to 'false'. Set these parameters if vCenter is used, even if DVS is not # used

abiquo.virtualfactory.azure.defaultLogin.propertyDescription: # Default password for virtual machines if not found in the template

abiquo.appliancemanager.checkMountedRepo.propertyDescription: # Perform the repository check against /etc/mtab. Set to false for local NFS # Server installations in testing environment: Monolithic, Cloud in a Box, # NFS on V2V Server or NFS on Remote Services

abiquo.virtualfactory.oraclevm.jobTimeou.propertyDescription: # The maximum length of time the Oracle VM Hypervisor Plugin will wait for # an individual API-based job to complete (milliseconds). The default is # 8 hours, but the valid range is 1 minute to 1 week. #

abiquo.vsm.actor.creation.delay.xenserve.propertyDescription: # The delay in milliseconds added between the creation of actors on # VSM start up for each hypervisor plugin (HV)

abiquo.storagemanager.netapp.debug.propertyDescription: # Records requests to ONTAP and responses in the Abiquo logs

abiquo.rabbitmq.requestedHeartbeat.propertyDescription: # The initially requested heartbeat interval, in seconds. The default value # of 0 means no heartbeat

abiquo.server.api.location.propertyDescription: # Address where the API is running. For example: http://80.169.25.32/api/. # Required for Remote Services (for Appliance manager, the address must be # reachable by cloud users). Recommended for Abiquo API Server (for Chef, the # address must be reachable from deployed VMs)

abiquo.httpProxy.password.propertyDescription: # Password of HTTP proxy for Appliance Manager/API to Internet communication # (download template definition list, template definition, VM disk file)

abiquo.server.sessionTimeout.propertyDescription: # Time the server waits before marking a client session as expired (minutes)

abiquo.tasks.history.size.propertyDescription: # Maximum length of task history in Redis for API/Server by owner

abiquo.vi.check.delay.propertyDescription: # Delay between executions of the virtual infrastructure check (milliseconds)

abiquo.virtualfactory.azure.retry.timeBe.propertyDescription: # Time to wait between polls during a retry

abiquo.api.networking.nicspervm.propertyDescription: # Limit of NICs per Virtual Machine. If this is set to 0, there are no limits

abiquo.server.mail.user.propertyDescription: # System user with privileges for connecting to the mail server

abiquo.server.timeout.propertyDescription: # Time the server waits for long requests (milliseconds) (Default value is 7 # days)

abiquo.virtualfactory.openSession.propertyDescription: # Maximum number of simultaneous operations on a single hypervisor

abiquo.vsm.pollingfrequency.softlayer.propertyDescription: # The delay between VSM polling of virtual machines in milliseconds # for each public cloud plugin (PC)

abiquo.server.mail.server.propertyDescription: # Address where the mail server is located

abiquo.vncport.max.propertyDescription: # Last port of the VNC range to be used when allocating virtual machines. # Note that VMware only recommends ports 5900 to 5964

client.USE_SECURE_CHANNEL_LOGIN.propertyDescription: # Configures the AMF secure channel (0 for regular, 1 for secure).

abiquo.vsm.vmsyncfrequency.azure.propertyDescription: # The delay between virtual machine synchronizer operations in milliseconds # for each public cloud plugin (PC)

abiquo.openstack.autoAllocateFloatingIps.propertyDescription: # Enable automatic Floating IP allocation. This property configures how # public IP addresses are assigned to the virtual machines deployed in # OpenStack clouds. If the virtual machines are not directly attached to a # public network, enabling this property will automatically allocate a # floating IP for the virtual machines. If virtual machines are deployed and # attached directly to a public network, then this property should be set to # false.

abiquo.abiquo.task.ttl.propertyDescription: # Number of virtual infrastructure check executions that a locked virtual # machine with a pending task can pass before it will be marked as failed

abiquo.virtualfactory.kvm.fullVirt.propertyDescription: # If set to false, libvirt machines will be created in KVM using PC emulation # (software emulation, slower). Emulation only works with x86 64-bit based # hosts, including virtual machines.

abiquo.appliancemanager.localRepositoryP.propertyDescription: # Folder where the abiquo.appliancemanager.repositoryLocation is mounted on # the remote services node

abiquo.httpProxy.host.propertyDescription: # IP Address of HTTP proxy for Appliance Manager/API to Internet # communication (download template definition list, template definition, VM # disk file)

abiquo.esxi.datastoreRdm.propertyDescription: # When using volumes, a VMFS datastore is required (Raw Device Mapping), if # the provided target datastore is not VMFS, then try to use the configured # datastore

abiquo.api.networking.allowMultipleNicsV.propertyDescription: # If false (or any other value), allow only one NIC per VLAN on a # VirtualMachine

abiquo.2fa.email.timestep.propertyDescription: # Timestep for the email provider. This value is the amount of time # the two factor authentication codes will be valid once generated. # (seconds) Default value is 60

abiquo.server.blockduplicatedsessions.propertyDescription: # If not supplied, it is set to false. When false, no action is taken if # multiple users are logged in with the same user account. The user who # logged in most recently will have true control of the session and actions # by other users may cause problems. When true, the most recent user has # control of the session and other users are warned and logged out

abiquo.redis.port.propertyDescription: # Port where Redis is located. By default Redis is installed on the Abiquo # Server in addition to the Remote Services machine. In a monolithic install, # the Redis host and port properties should point to the monolithic # server. When configuring API load balancing, only the Abiquo Server Redis # property should point to the central datanode

abiquo.nodecollector.timeout.propertyDescription: # Timeout for Server/API connections to Nodecollector (Discovery manager) # (milliseconds)

abiquo.nodecollector.infcheck.threads.propertyDescription: # Infrastructure check concurrent machine checks # This number should be tied to the number of cores # of the machine running discovery manager service

abiquo.appliancemanager.fstimeoutms.propertyDescription: # Maximum time for the appliance manager to perform a complete rescan of the # repository filesystem # (milliseconds)

abiquo.appliancemanager.repository.ignor.propertyDescription: # Path names prefixes to be ignored in the repository refresh #(Comma separate value)

abiquo.storagemanager.netapp.volumelunra.propertyDescription: # Optional ratio to allow a LUN of a provided size to fill on its container # volume (volSize = lunSize * volumelunratio).

abiquo.ha.check.delay.propertyDescription: # Delay between checks of all machines with state HA_IN_PROGRESS to determine # if HA tasks on all VMs are complete, and if so, then set machine state to # DISABLED_BY_HA (milliseconds) (Default value is 5 minutes)

abiquo.storagemanager.netapp.initiatorGr.propertyDescription: # Optional initial initiator group will be created

abiquo.virtualfactory.oraclevm.hardParti.propertyDescription: # Expected ratio of virtual CPUs to Physical CPU cores (integer). For best # performance, set to 1. To reduce physical CPUs per VM and thus licensing # costs, set to a higher value. For example, A value of 1 means a 4xCPU VM # will be pinned to 4 physical CPUs whereas a value of 4 means a 4xCPU VM # will be pinned to one physical CPU.

abiquo.virtualfactory.oraclevm.ha.propertyDescription: # This setting controls whether VMs created by Abiquo are configured within # Oracle VM for ‘High Availability’.   The default value is ‘false’ (no HA # support).   If set to ‘true’, then Abiquo will deploy a VM for HA if the # Oracle VM Server hosting the VM is part of a Clustered Server Pool. # Note that when a VM is re-configured, Abiquo will NOT update the HA status # of the VM. # Please note that some manual configuration of Oracle VM may be required for # HA to be performed successfully - please review Oracle VM details in the # Abiquo wiki for more details.

abiquo.dvs.portgroup.maxsize.propertyDescription: # Number of available ports in each port group

abiquo.esxi.metrics.uptime.propertyRange: true, false abiquo.esxi.metrics.cpu-mz=true abiquo.esxi.metrics.cpu-time=true biquo.esxi.metrics.memory-swap=true biquo.esxi.metrics.memory-swap2=true biquo.esxi.metrics.memory-vmmemctl=true biquo.esxi.metrics.memory-physical=true biquo.esxi.metrics.memory-host=true biquo.esxi.metrics.disk-latency=true
abiquo.esxi.metrics.uptime.propertyDescription: # To prevent Abiquo from retrieving metrics, set the property to false # for each ESXi metric (METRIC).

abiquo.appliancemanager.repository.ignor.propertyDescription: # Path names suffixes to be ignored in the repository refresh #(java Regular Expression format)
# Path names suffixes to be ignored in the repository refresh #(Comma separate value)

abiquo.server.remoteSpace.default.propertyDescription: # Default remote repository space (OVF package sources) attached to # all appliance libraries

abiquo.virtualfactory.azure.storageAccou.propertyDescription: # Prefix of the name of the Azure Storage account created for deployments (one # account per region)

abiquo.ldap.authentication.custom.userDn.propertyDescription: # Abiquo will perform an additional custom query against the specified schema # in the LDAP/Active Directory. This value is required. The default value # does not result in an additional query

abiquo.redis.host.propertyDescription: # Address where Redis is located. By default Redis is installed on the Abiquo # Server in addition to the Remote Services machine. In a monolithic install, # the Redis host and port properties should point to the monolithic server. # When configuring API load balancing, only the Abiquo Server Redis property # should point to the central datanode

abiquo.appliancemanager.deploy.connectio.propertyDescription: # Timeout for HTTP connections to be established when downloading a virtual # machine template (milliseconds)

abiquo.m.consumerKey.propertyDescription: # OAuth consumer key that M should use to perform requests to the Abiquo Server (API) # If these tokens are set, M will use OAuth authentication. Otherwise Basic # Authentication will be used.

com.abiquo.virtualfactory.esxi.timeoutCo.propertyDescription: # Time to wait to establish the connection to ESX (milliseconds)

abiquo.virtualfactory.azure.wait.timeBet.propertyDescription: # Time to wait between polls during an operation wait

abiquo.api.zk.serverConnection.propertyDescription: # Location where ZooKeeper is listening in format <IP address>:<port> for # example, 10.10.10.10:2181

abiquo.2fa.issuer.propertyDescription: # Name of the issuer of the two factor verification codes. This will # appear in the user's Google Authenticator app to identify where the # generated code comes from

abiquo.ha.infcheck.cycles.propertyDescription: # Number of failed infratructure checks on a machine before High Availability # is triggered and the machine is set to state HA_IN_PROGRESS

abiquo.m.credential.propertyDescription: # Credentials that M should use to perform requests to the Abiquo Server (API)

abiquo.ldap.authentication.server.baseDN.propertyDescription: # Base Distinguished Name of the LDAP/Active Directory

abiquo.dvs.portgroup.loadsharingmechanis.propertyDescription: # Network adapter teaming policy in DVS port groups. This property controls # the algorithm used for network adapter load balancing when multiple NICs # are used in 'teaming mode'.

com.abiquo.virtualfactory.esxi.timeoutRe.propertyDescription: # Time to wait to read from the connection to ESX (milliseconds)

abiquo.api.max.sessions.propertyDescription: # Maximum number of sessions per user in the API. The default value of -1 means # there is no limit and a value of 0 is invalid.

abiquo.virtualfactory.oraclevm.defaultVM.propertyDescription: # Create all Oracle VMs with this domain type. Options are (Hardware # Virtualized [HVM], Paravirtualized [PVM], Hardware Virtualized with # Paravirtualized drivers [PVHVM]). #

workflow.read.timeout.propertyDescription: # Maximum waiting time in milliseconds to receive data from workflow endpoint

abiquo.m.consumerSecret.propertyDescription: # OAuth consumer secret that M should use to perform requests to the Abiquo Server (API)

abiquo.httpProxy.port.propertyDescription: # Port of HTTP proxy for Appliance Manager/API to Internet communication # (download template definition list, template definition, VM disk file)

abiquo.api.login.failurelapse.propertyDescription: # Lapse of time in seconds where abiquo.api.login.maxtries apply

abiquo.pcrsync.retrydelayms.propertyDescription: # Milliseconds to wait before retry a PCR synchronize in the same enterprise and PCR

abiquo.virtualfactory.oraclevm.jobStatus.propertyDescription: # Polling period for the job status check to monitor the status of # asynchronous hypervisor jobs (milliseconds). Defaults to 1 second, with a # valid range of 0.1 second to 1 minute.

abiquo.appliancemanager.deploy.totalTime.propertyDescription: # Timeout for HTTP connections when downloading a virtual machine template # (milliseconds)

abiquo.appliancemanager.repositoryLocati.propertyDescription: # Local Appliance Library, NFS repository location denoted by # nfs-server-address:exportpath

abiquo.vsm.measures.pusher.frequency.propertyDescription: # The heartbeat frequency of measures pusher in milliseconds. Or the delay # between reconnection process to Kairos.

abiquo.ldap.authentication.attribute.ent.propertyDescription: # The attribute in LDAP/Active Directory to look up the Enterprise Name which # must be an Enterprise in Abiquo.

abiquo.kairosdb.port.propertyDescription: # Port where KairosDb is listening for VM monitoring

abiquo.ldap.authentication.server.port.propertyDescription: # LDAP/Active Directory port. In LDAP mode this property is required, even if # the server is listening at the default LDAP/Active Directory port

abiquo.ldap.authentication.autoUserCreat.propertyDescription: # Whether Abiquo must create a user in Abiquo based on a successful login to # LDAP

abiquo.virtualfactory.oraclevm.repositor.propertyDescription: # NFS Repository location denoted by nfs-server-address:exportpath used by # Oracle VM.   Defaults to the value of # ‘abiquo.appliancemanager.repositoryLocation’ if not explicitly specified # in the abiquo.properties file.

abiquo.api.login.maxtries.propertyDescription: # Max login failures in a given a lapse (abiquo.api.login.failurelapse)

abiquo.appliancemanager.client.timeoutIn.propertyDescription: # Timeout for HTTP connections to the ApplianceManager Server when using the # ApplianceManager Client, this property configures read and connection timeout # (milliseconds)

abiquo.pcrsyncpool.propertyDescription: # Number of concurrent PCR synchronize ops at a given time (not in the same enterprise and PCR)

abiquo.server.mail.password.propertyDescription: # Password for connecting to the mail server

abiquo.tasks.trimmer.delay.propertyDescription: # Delay between executions of the trimmer of task history in Redis for # API/Server (milliseconds)

abiquo.vsm.max.backoff.propertyDescription: # Maximum backoff time in seconds between connection errors to reduce load and # logging of these errors. A counter has been added to register the number of # failed attempts to connect to the hypervisor or public cloud to perform any # type of operation. When rescheduling operations, Abiquo will multiply the # maximum backoff time by the number of failed connection attempts to determine # the wait time until the next try. If a connection is established, the error # counter is reset.

abiquo.auth.module.propertyDescription: # Whether Abiquo will authenticate only via database or it will also # authenticate against LDAP/Active Directory.

abiquo.docker.registry.tags.propertyDescription: # Comma separated list of tag patterns allowed. Existing tags in the # Docker registry will be matched against these patterns and Abiquo will # only show the ones that match. The format of the pattern is defined # by the Java pattern: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html # Example: ^fixedtag$,^tagswithprefix

abiquo.m.accessToken.propertyDescription: # OAuth access token that M should use to perform requests to the Abiquo Server (API)

abiquo.datacenter.id.propertyDescription: # Identify the AMQP datacenter queues. The Datacenter ID is used for building # routing keys and queue names, so that they are unique for each datacenter. # Warning: Do not change this property! This property is required and the # value is generated at installation. You can recover the property's value # through the API with Get Datacenter

abiquo.storagemanager.netapp.aggrfreespa.propertyDescription: # Recommended free space on NetApp aggregates.

abiquo.dvs.vcenter.user.propertyDescription: # Username of the vCenter user account. Create a user account with the same # password in the vCenter in order to use the DVS or vCenter with Abiquo. In # vSphere 5.1, you must create this account in an Active Directory domain or # using a VMware Single Sign-on system, NOT as a local Windows account on the # vCenter. If 'abiquo.dvs.enabled' is set to true, the property is required. # The DVS vCenter user and password properties are also used for connecting # to vCenter even if DVS is not used, for example, when deleting orphans. So # the user and password properties can be used even when abiquo.dvs.enabled # is set to 'false'. Set these parameters if vCenter is used, even if DVS is # not used

abiquo.appliancemanager.deploy.idle.propertyDescription: # Timeout for idle HTTP connections when downloading a virtual machine template # (milliseconds)
